div.ab: or to be safer, go away until the fire will have completely died down and all will have cooled. For the exalation will be dangerous. And for that occasion, when you take it with some tongs, wash your mouth with some good vinegar & take some preservative & cover yourself well. Once it dies, put it in a cloth or a canvas of silk & fold it & hang it from the ceiling, where the air or & sun will dry it. Once it is quite dry, pulverize it in a mortar. And keep this powder carefully, because one ℥ of this thrown on iii lb of melted ♁ reduces it into finer ☉ than the other one. But it is of not so much weight. One needs also for this work to choose the oldest ♁ that you can, which has often been melted before & finely hammered into blades or other works, & at first purify it by melting & throwing it into some honey & vinegar. The term for the work is nine months from Saint John until the 25th April.

Who wants to have it beautiful & p very delicate, one needs to pick it before the fd seed may be perfectly ripe. For if one waits for the seed to be perfectly ripe, the foot is so dried by the sun that it is brittle & breakable. It is true that in this way the seed is reduced by a third.

div.head: Colors
div.ab: If you want to keep them beautiful in gum and such that they do not lose any of their natural color, put white wine, the whitest and clearest you can, in a bottle with a little tragacanth gum. And having stoppered the bottle, scramble & shake it very strongly together, & let it rest until the tragacanth is dissolved. Also put in a little fine-grained sel blanc to brighten the whole. Some mix clear water with white wine, and with this mixture they temper the colors without grinding. And these show very beautifully on illumination works.
